0028 
0029 import java.io.IOException;
0030 import java.io.StringWriter;
0031 import java.io.Writer;
0032 import java.lang.reflect.Field;
0033 import java.lang.reflect.Method;
0034 import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
0035 import java.util.Collection;
0036 import java.util.Enumeration;

0044 
0045 /**
0046 * A JSONObject is an unordered collection of name/value pairs. Its external
0047 * form is a string wrapped in curly braces with colons between the names and
0048 * values, and commas between the values and names. The internal form is an
0049 * object having <code>get</code> and <code>opt</code> methods for accessing
0050 * the values by name, and <code>put</code> methods for adding or replacing
0051 * values by name. The values can be any of these types: <code>Boolean</code>,
0052 * <code>JSONArray</code>, <code>JSONObject</code>, <code>Number</code>,
0053 * <code>String</code>, or the <code>JSONObject.NULL</code> object. A
0054 * JSONObject constructor can be used to convert an external form JSON text
0055 * into an internal form whose values can be retrieved with the
0056 * <code>get</code> and <code>opt</code> methods, or to convert values into a
0057 * JSON text using the <code>put</code> and <code>toString</code> methods. A
0058 * <code>get</code> method returns a value if one can be found, and throws an
0059 * exception if one cannot be found. An <code>opt</code> method returns a
0060 * default value instead of throwing an exception, and so is useful for
0061 * obtaining optional values.
0062 * <p>
0063 * The generic <code>get()</code> and <code>opt()</code> methods return an
0064 * object, which you can cast or query for type. There are also typed
0065 * <code>get</code> and <code>opt</code> methods that do type checking and type
0066 * coercion for you. The opt methods differ from the get methods in that they
0067 * do not throw. Instead, they return a specified value, such as null.
0068 * <p>
0069 * The <code>put</code> methods add or replace values in an object. For
0070 * example,
0071 *
0072 * <pre>
0073 * myString = new JSONObject()
0074 * .put(&quot;JSON&quot;, &quot;Hello, World!&quot;).toString();
0075 * </pre>
0076 *
0077 * produces the string <code>{"JSON": "Hello, World"}</code>.
0078 * <p>
0079 * The texts produced by the <code>toString</code> methods strictly conform to
0080 * the JSON syntax rules. The constructors are more forgiving in the texts they
0081 * will accept:
0082 * <ul>
0083 * <li>An extra <code>,</code>&nbsp;<small>(comma)</small> may appear just
0084 * before the closing brace.</li>
0085 * <li>Strings may be quoted with <code>'</code>&nbsp;<small>(single
0086 * quote)</small>.</li>
0087 * <li>Strings do not need to be quoted at all if they do not begin with a
0088 * quote or single quote, and if they do not contain leading or trailing
0089 * spaces, and if they do not contain any of these characters:
0090 * <code>{ } [ ] / \ : , #</code> and if they do not look like numbers and
0091 * if they are not the reserved words <code>true</code>, <code>false</code>,
0092 * or <code>null</code>.</li>
0093 * </ul>
0094 *
0095 * @author JSON.org
0096 * @version 2013-06-17
0097 */
0098 class JSONObject
0099 {
0100 
0101 /**
0102 * JSONObject.NULL is equivalent to the value that JavaScript calls null,
0103 * whilst Java's null is equivalent to the value that JavaScript calls
0104 * undefined.
0105 */
0106     private static final class Null {
0107 
0108         /**
0109 * There is only intended to be a single instance of the NULL object,
0110 * so the clone method returns itself.
0111 *
0112 * @return NULL.
0113 */
0114         protected final Object clone() {
0115             return this;
0116         }
0117 
0118         /**
0119 * A Null object is equal to the null value and to itself.
0120 *
0121 * @param object
0122 * An object to test for nullness.
0123 * @return true if the object parameter is the JSONObject.NULL object or
0124 * null.
0125 */
0126         public boolean equals(Object object) {
0127             return object == null || object == this;
0128         }
0129 
0130         /**
0131 * Get the "null" string value.
0132 *
0133 * @return The string "null".
0134 */
0135         public String toString() {
0136             return "null";
0137         }
0138     }
0139 
0140     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
0141     // Constants
0142     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
0143 
0144     /**
0145 * It is sometimes more convenient and less ambiguous to have a
0146 * <code>NULL</code> object than to use Java's <code>null</code> value.
0147 * <code>JSONObject.NULL.equals(null)</code> returns <code>true</code>.
0148 * <code>JSONObject.NULL.toString()</code> returns <code>"null"</code>.
0149 */
0150     public static final Object NULL = new Null();
0151 
0152     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
0153     // Variables
0154     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
0155 
0156     /**
0157 * The map where the JSONObject's properties are kept.
0158 */
0159     private final Map map;
0160 
0161 
0162     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
0163     // Constructors
0164     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
0165 
0166     /**
0167 * Construct an empty JSONObject.
0168 */
0169     public JSONObject() {
0170         this.map = new HashMap();
0171     }
0172 
0173     /**
0174 * Construct a JSONObject from a subset of another JSONObject. An array of
0175 * strings is used to identify the keys that should be copied. Missing keys
0176 * are ignored.
0177 *
0178 * @param jo
0179 * A JSONObject.
0180 * @param names
0181 * An array of strings.
0182 * @throws JSONException
0183 * @exception JSONException
0184 * If a value is a non-finite number or if a name is
0185 * duplicated.
0186 */
0187     public JSONObject(JSONObject jo, String[] names) {
0188         this();
0189         for (int i = 0; i < names.length; i += 1) {
0190             try {
0191                 this.putOnce(names[i], jo.opt(names[i]));
0192             } catch (Exception ignore) {
0193             }
0194         }
0195     }
0196 
0197     /**
0198 * Construct a JSONObject from a JSONTokener.
0199 *
0200 * @param x
0201 * A JSONTokener object containing the source string.
0202 * @throws JSONException
0203 * If there is a syntax error in the source string or a
0204 * duplicated key.
0205 */
0206     public JSONObject(JSONTokener x) throws JSONException {
0207         this();
0208         char c;
0209         String key;
0210 
0211         if (x.nextClean() != '{') {
0212             throw x.syntaxError("A JSONObject text must begin with '{'");
0213         }
0214         for (;;) {
0215             c = x.nextClean();
0216             switch (c) {
0217             case 0:
0218                 throw x.syntaxError("A JSONObject text must end with '}'");
0219             case '}':
0220                 return;
0221             default:
0222                 x.back();
0223                 key = x.nextValue().toString();
0224             }
0225 
0226 // The key is followed by ':'.
0227 
0228             c = x.nextClean();
0229             if (c != ':') {
0230                 throw x.syntaxError("Expected a ':' after a key");
0231             }
0232             this.putOnce(key, x.nextValue());
0233 
0234 // Pairs are separated by ','.
0235 
0236             switch (x.nextClean()) {
0237             case ';':
0238             case ',':
0239                 if (x.nextClean() == '}') {
0240                     return;
0241                 }
0242                 x.back();
0243                 break;
0244             case '}':
0245                 return;
0246             default:
0247                 throw x.syntaxError("Expected a ',' or '}'");
0248             }
0249         }
0250     }
0251 
0252     /**
0253 * Construct a JSONObject from a Map.
0254 *
0255 * @param map
0256 * A map object that can be used to initialize the contents of
0257 * the JSONObject.
0258 * @throws JSONException
0259 */
0260     public JSONObject(Map map) {
0261         this.map = new HashMap();
0262         if (map != null) {
0263             Iterator i = map.entrySet().iterator();
0264             while (i.hasNext()) {
0265                 Map.Entry e = (Map.Entry) i.next();
0266                 Object value = e.getValue();
0267                 if (value != null) {
0268                     this.map.put(e.getKey(), wrap(value));
0269                 }
0270             }
0271         }
0272     }
0273 
0274     /**
0275 * Construct a JSONObject from an Object using bean getters. It reflects on
0276 * all of the public methods of the object. For each of the methods with no
0277 * parameters and a name starting with <code>"get"</code> or
0278 * <code>"is"</code> followed by an uppercase letter, the method is invoked,
0279 * and a key and the value returned from the getter method are put into the
0280 * new JSONObject.
0281 *
0282 * The key is formed by removing the <code>"get"</code> or <code>"is"</code>
0283 * prefix. If the second remaining character is not upper case, then the
0284 * first character is converted to lower case.
0285 *
0286 * For example, if an object has a method named <code>"getName"</code>, and
0287 * if the result of calling <code>object.getName()</code> is
0288 * <code>"Larry Fine"</code>, then the JSONObject will contain
0289 * <code>"name": "Larry Fine"</code>.
0290 *
0291 * @param bean
0292 * An object that has getter methods that should be used to make
0293 * a JSONObject.
0294 */
0295     public JSONObject(Object bean) {
0296         this();
0297         this.populateMap(bean);
0298     }
0299 
0300     /**
0301 * Construct a JSONObject from an Object, using reflection to find the
0302 * public members. The resulting JSONObject's keys will be the strings from
0303 * the names array, and the values will be the field values associated with
0304 * those keys in the object. If a key is not found or not visible, then it
0305 * will not be copied into the new JSONObject.
0306 *
0307 * @param object
0308 * An object that has fields that should be used to make a
0309 * JSONObject.
0310 * @param names
0311 * An array of strings, the names of the fields to be obtained
0312 * from the object.
0313 */
0314     public JSONObject(Object object, String names[]) {
0315         this();
0316         Class c = object.getClass();
0317         for (int i = 0; i < names.length; i += 1) {
0318             String name = names[i];
0319             try {
0320                 this.putOpt(name, c.getField(name).get(object));
0321             } catch (Exception ignore) {
0322             }
0323         }
0324     }
0325 
0326     /**
0327 * Construct a JSONObject from a source JSON text string. This is the most
0328 * commonly used JSONObject constructor.
0329 *
0330 * @param source
0331 * A string beginning with <code>{</code>&nbsp;<small>(left
0332 * brace)</small> and ending with <code>}</code>
0333 * &nbsp;<small>(right brace)</small>.
0334 * @exception JSONException
0335 * If there is a syntax error in the source string or a
0336 * duplicated key.
0337 */
0338     public JSONObject(String source) throws JSONException {
0339         this(new JSONTokener(source));
0340     }
0341 
0342     /**
0343 * Construct a JSONObject from a ResourceBundle.
0344 *
0345 * @param baseName
0346 * The ResourceBundle base name.
0347 * @param locale
0348 * The Locale to load the ResourceBundle for.
0349 * @throws JSONException
0350 * If any JSONExceptions are detected.
0351 */
0352     public JSONObject(String baseName, Locale locale) throws JSONException {
0353         this();
0354         ResourceBundle bundle = ResourceBundle.getBundle(baseName, locale,
0355                 Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader());
0356 
0357 // Iterate through the keys in the bundle.
0358 
0359         Enumeration keys = bundle.getKeys();
0360         while (keys.hasMoreElements()) {
0361             Object key = keys.nextElement();
0362             if (key instanceof String) {
0363 
0364 // Go through the path, ensuring that there is a nested JSONObject for each
0365 // segment except the last. Add the value using the last segment's name into
0366 // the deepest nested JSONObject.
0367 
0368                 String[] path = ((String) key).split("\\.");
0369                 int last = path.length - 1;
0370                 JSONObject target = this;
0371                 for (int i = 0; i < last; i += 1) {
0372                     String segment = path[i];
0373                     JSONObject nextTarget = target.optJSONObject(segment);
0374                     if (nextTarget == null) {
0375                         nextTarget = new JSONObject();
0376                         target.put(segment, nextTarget);
0377                     }
0378                     target = nextTarget;
0379                 }
0380                 target.put(path[last], bundle.getString((String) key));
0381             }
0382         }
0383     }
0384 
0385     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
0386     // Methods
0387     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
0388 
0389     /**
0390 * Accumulate values under a key. It is similar to the put method except
0391 * that if there is already an object stored under the key then a JSONArray
0392 * is stored under the key to hold all of the accumulated values. If there
0393 * is already a JSONArray, then the new value is appended to it. In
0394 * contrast, the put method replaces the previous value.
0395 *
0396 * If only one value is accumulated that is not a JSONArray, then the result
0397 * will be the same as using put. But if multiple values are accumulated,
0398 * then the result will be like append.
0399 *
0400 * @param key
0401 * A key string.
0402 * @param value
0403 * An object to be accumulated under the key.
0404 * @return this.
0405 * @throws JSONException
0406 * If the value is an invalid number or if the key is null.
0407 */
0408     public JSONObject accumulate(String key, Object value) throws JSONException {
0409         testValidity(value);
0410         Object object = this.opt(key);
0411         if (object == null) {
0412             this.put(key,
0413                     value instanceof JSONArray ? new JSONArray().put(value)
0414                             : value);
0415         } else if (object instanceof JSONArray) {
0416             ((JSONArray) object).put(value);
0417         } else {
0418             this.put(key, new JSONArray().put(object).put(value));
0419         }
0420         return this;
0421     }
0422 
0423     /**
0424 * Append values to the array under a key. If the key does not exist in the
0425 * JSONObject, then the key is put in the JSONObject with its value being a
0426 * JSONArray containing the value parameter. If the key was already
0427 * associated with a JSONArray, then the value parameter is appended to it.
0428 *
0429 * @param key
0430 * A key string.
0431 * @param value
0432 * An object to be accumulated under the key.
0433 * @return this.
0434 * @throws JSONException
0435 * If the key is null or if the current value associated with
0436 * the key is not a JSONArray.
0437 */
0438     public JSONObject append(String key, Object value) throws JSONException {
0439         testValidity(value);
0440         Object object = this.opt(key);
0441         if (object == null) {
0442             this.put(key, new JSONArray().put(value));
0443         } else if (object instanceof JSONArray) {
0444             this.put(key, ((JSONArray) object).put(value));
0445         } else {
0446             throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + key
0447                     + "] is not a JSONArray.");
0448         }
0449         return this;
0450     }
0451 
0452     /**
0453 * Produce a string from a double. The string "null" will be returned if the
0454 * number is not finite.
0455 *
0456 * @param d
0457 * A double.
0458 * @return A String.
0459 */
0460     public static String doubleToString(double d) {
0461         if (Double.isInfinite(d) || Double.isNaN(d)) {
0462             return "null";
0463         }
0464 
0465 // Shave off trailing zeros and decimal point, if possible.
0466 
0467         String string = Double.toString(d);
0468         if (string.indexOf('.') > 0 && string.indexOf('e') < 0
0469                 && string.indexOf('E') < 0) {
0470             while (string.endsWith("0")) {
0471                 string = string.substring(0, string.length() - 1);
0472             }
0473             if (string.endsWith(".")) {
0474                 string = string.substring(0, string.length() - 1);
0475             }
0476         }
0477         return string;
0478     }
0479 
0480     /**
0481 * Get the value object associated with a key.
0482 *
0483 * @param key
0484 * A key string.
0485 * @return The object associated with the key.
0486 * @throws JSONException
0487 * if the key is not found.
0488 */
0489     public Object get(String key) throws JSONException {
0490         if (key == null) {
0491             throw new JSONException("Null key.");
0492         }
0493         Object object = this.opt(key);
0494         if (object == null) {
0495             throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + quote(key) + "] not found.");
0496         }
0497         return object;
0498     }
0499 
0500     /**
0501 * Get the boolean value associated with a key.
0502 *
0503 * @param key
0504 * A key string.
0505 * @return The truth.
0506 * @throws JSONException
0507 * if the value is not a Boolean or the String "true" or
0508 * "false".
0509 */
0510     public boolean getBoolean(String key) throws JSONException {
0511         Object object = this.get(key);
0512         if (object.equals(Boolean.FALSE)
0513                 || (object instanceof String && ((String) object)
0514                         .equalsIgnoreCase("false"))) {
0515             return false;
0516         } else if (object.equals(Boolean.TRUE)
0517                 || (object instanceof String && ((String) object)
0518                         .equalsIgnoreCase("true"))) {
0519             return true;
0520         }
0521         throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + quote(key)
0522                 + "] is not a Boolean.");
0523     }
0524 
0525     /**
0526 * Get the double value associated with a key.
0527 *
0528 * @param key
0529 * A key string.
0530 * @return The numeric value.
0531 * @throws JSONException
0532 * if the key is not found or if the value is not a Number
0533 * object and cannot be converted to a number.
0534 */
0535     public double getDouble(String key) throws JSONException {
0536         Object object = this.get(key);
0537         try {
0538             return object instanceof Number ? ((Number) object).doubleValue()
0539                     : Double.parseDouble((String) object);
0540         } catch (Exception e) {
0541             throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + quote(key)
0542                     + "] is not a number.");
0543         }
0544     }
0545 
0546     /**
0547 * Get the int value associated with a key.
0548 *
0549 * @param key
0550 * A key string.
0551 * @return The integer value.
0552 * @throws JSONException
0553 * if the key is not found or if the value cannot be converted
0554 * to an integer.
0555 */
0556     public int getInt(String key) throws JSONException {
0557         Object object = this.get(key);
0558         try {
0559             return object instanceof Number ? ((Number) object).intValue()
0560                     : Integer.parseInt((String) object);
0561         } catch (Exception e) {
0562             throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + quote(key)
0563                     + "] is not an int.");
0564         }
0565     }
0566 
0567     /**
0568 * Get the JSONArray value associated with a key.
0569 *
0570 * @param key
0571 * A key string.
0572 * @return A JSONArray which is the value.
0573 * @throws JSONException
0574 * if the key is not found or if the value is not a JSONArray.
0575 */
0576     public JSONArray getJSONArray(String key) throws JSONException {
0577         Object object = this.get(key);
0578         if (object instanceof JSONArray) {
0579             return (JSONArray) object;
0580         }
0581         throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + quote(key)
0582                 + "] is not a JSONArray.");
0583     }
0584 
0585     /**
0586 * Get the JSONObject value associated with a key.
0587 *
0588 * @param key
0589 * A key string.
0590 * @return A JSONObject which is the value.
0591 * @throws JSONException
0592 * if the key is not found or if the value is not a JSONObject.
0593 */
0594     public JSONObject getJSONObject(String key) throws JSONException {
0595         Object object = this.get(key);
0596         if (object instanceof JSONObject) {
0597             return (JSONObject) object;
0598         }
0599         throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + quote(key)
0600                 + "] is not a JSONObject.");
0601     }
0602 
0603     /**
0604 * Get the long value associated with a key.
0605 *
0606 * @param key
0607 * A key string.
0608 * @return The long value.
0609 * @throws JSONException
0610 * if the key is not found or if the value cannot be converted
0611 * to a long.
0612 */
0613     public long getLong(String key) throws JSONException {
0614         Object object = this.get(key);
0615         try {
0616             return object instanceof Number ? ((Number) object).longValue()
0617                     : Long.parseLong((String) object);
0618         } catch (Exception e) {
0619             throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + quote(key)
0620                     + "] is not a long.");
0621         }
0622     }
0623 
0624     /**
0625 * Get an array of field names from a JSONObject.
0626 *
0627 * @return An array of field names, or null if there are no names.
0628 */
0629     public static String[] getNames(JSONObject jo) {
0630         int length = jo.length();
0631         if (length == 0) {
0632             return null;
0633         }
0634         Iterator iterator = jo.keys();
0635         String[] names = new String[length];
0636         int i = 0;
0637         while (iterator.hasNext()) {
0638             names[i] = (String) iterator.next();
0639             i += 1;
0640         }
0641         return names;
0642     }
0643 
0644     /**
0645 * Get an array of field names from an Object.
0646 *
0647 * @return An array of field names, or null if there are no names.
0648 */
0649     public static String[] getNames(Object object) {
0650         if (object == null) {
0651             return null;
0652         }
0653         Class klass = object.getClass();
0654         Field[] fields = klass.getFields();
0655         int length = fields.length;
0656         if (length == 0) {
0657             return null;
0658         }
0659         String[] names = new String[length];
0660         for (int i = 0; i < length; i += 1) {
0661             names[i] = fields[i].getName();
0662         }
0663         return names;
0664     }
0665 
0666     /**
0667 * Get the string associated with a key.
0668 *
0669 * @param key
0670 * A key string.
0671 * @return A string which is the value.
0672 * @throws JSONException
0673 * if there is no string value for the key.
0674 */
0675     public String getString(String key) throws JSONException {
0676         Object object = this.get(key);
0677         if (object instanceof String) {
0678             return (String) object;
0679         }
0680         throw new JSONException("JSONObject[" + quote(key) + "] not a string.");
0681     }
0682 
0683     /**
0684 * Determine if the JSONObject contains a specific key.
0685 *
0686 * @param key
0687 * A key string.
0688 * @return true if the key exists in the JSONObject.
0689 */
0690     public boolean has(String key) {
0691         return this.map.containsKey(key);
0692     }
0693 
0694     /**
0695 * Increment a property of a JSONObject. If there is no such property,
0696 * create one with a value of 1. If there is such a property, and if it is
0697 * an Integer, Long, Double, or Float, then add one to it.
0698 *
0699 * @param key
0700 * A key string.
0701 * @return this.
0702 * @throws JSONException
0703 * If there is already a property with this name that is not an
0704 * Integer, Long, Double, or Float.
0705 */
0706     public JSONObject increment(String key) throws JSONException {
0707         Object value = this.opt(key);
0708         if (value == null) {
0709             this.put(key, 1);
0710         } else if (value instanceof Integer) {
0711             this.put(key, ((Integer) value).intValue() + 1);
0712         } else if (value instanceof Long) {
0713             this.put(key, ((Long) value).longValue() + 1);
0714         } else if (value instanceof Double) {
0715             this.put(key, ((Double) value).doubleValue() + 1);
0716         } else if (value instanceof Float) {
0717             this.put(key, ((Float) value).floatValue() + 1);
0718         } else {
0719             throw new JSONException("Unable to increment [" + quote(key) + "].");
0720         }
0721         return this;
0722     }
0723 
0724     /**
0725 * Determine if the value associated with the key is null or if there is no
0726 * value.
0727 *
0728 * @param key
0729 * A key string.
0730 * @return true if there is no value associated with the key or if the value
0731 * is the JSONObject.NULL object.
0732 */
0733     public boolean isNull(String key) {
0734         return JSONObject.NULL.equals(this.opt(key));
0735     }
0736 
0737     /**
0738 * Get an enumeration of the keys of the JSONObject.
0739 *
0740 * @return An iterator of the keys.
0741 */
0742     public Iterator keys() {
0743         return this.keySet().iterator();
0744     }
0745 
0746     /**
0747 * Get a set of keys of the JSONObject.
0748 *
0749 * @return A keySet.
0750 */
0751     public Set keySet() {
0752         return this.map.keySet();
0753     }
0754 
0755     /**
0756 * Get the number of keys stored in the JSONObject.
0757 *
0758 * @return The number of keys in the JSONObject.
0759 */
0760     public int length() {
0761         return this.map.size();
0762     }
0763 
0764     /**
0765 * Produce a JSONArray containing the names of the elements of this
0766 * JSONObject.
0767 *
0768 * @return A JSONArray containing the key strings, or null if the JSONObject
0769 * is empty.
0770 */
0771     public JSONArray names() {
0772         JSONArray ja = new JSONArray();
0773         Iterator keys = this.keys();
0774         while (keys.hasNext()) {
0775             ja.put(keys.next());
0776         }
0777         return ja.length() == 0 ? null : ja;
0778     }
0779 
0780     /**
0781 * Produce a string from a Number.
0782 *
0783 * @param number
0784 * A Number
0785 * @return A String.
0786 * @throws JSONException
0787 * If n is a non-finite number.
0788 */
0789     public static String numberToString(Number number) throws JSONException {
0790         if (number == null) {
0791             throw new JSONException("Null pointer");
0792         }
0793         testValidity(number);
0794 
0795 // Shave off trailing zeros and decimal point, if possible.
0796 
0797         String string = number.toString();
0798         if (string.indexOf('.') > 0 && string.indexOf('e') < 0
0799                 && string.indexOf('E') < 0) {
0800             while (string.endsWith("0")) {
0801                 string = string.substring(0, string.length() - 1);
0802             }
0803             if (string.endsWith(".")) {
0804                 string = string.substring(0, string.length() - 1);
0805             }
0806         }
0807         return string;
0808     }
0809 
0810     /**
0811 * Get an optional value associated with a key.
0812 *
0813 * @param key
0814 * A key string.
0815 * @return An object which is the value, or null if there is no value.
0816 */
0817     public Object opt(String key) {
0818         return key == null ? null : this.map.get(key);
0819     }
0820 
0821     /**
0822 * Get an optional boolean associated with a key. It returns false if there
0823 * is no such key, or if the value is not Boolean.TRUE or the String "true".
0824 *
0825 * @param key
0826 * A key string.
0827 * @return The truth.
0828 */
0829     public boolean optBoolean(String key) {
0830         return this.optBoolean(key, false);
0831     }
0832 
0833     /**
0834 * Get an optional boolean associated with a key. It returns the
0835 * defaultValue if there is no such key, or if it is not a Boolean or the
0836 * String "true" or "false" (case insensitive).
0837 *
0838 * @param key
0839 * A key string.
0840 * @param defaultValue
0841 * The default.
0842 * @return The truth.
0843 */
0844     public boolean optBoolean(String key, boolean defaultValue) {
0845         try {
0846             return this.getBoolean(key);
0847         } catch (Exception e) {
0848             return defaultValue;
0849         }
0850     }
0851 
0852     /**
0853 * Get an optional double associated with a key, or NaN if there is no such
0854 * key or if its value is not a number. If the value is a string, an attempt
0855 * will be made to evaluate it as a number.
0856 *
0857 * @param key
0858 * A string which is the key.
0859 * @return An object which is the value.
0860 */
0861     public double optDouble(String key) {
0862         return this.optDouble(key, Double.NaN);
0863     }
0864

0866 * Get an optional double associated with a key, or the defaultValue if
0867 * there is no such key or if its value is not a number. If the value is a
0868 * string, an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.
0869 *
0870 * @param key
0871 * A key string.
0872 * @param defaultValue
0873 * The default.
0874 * @return An object which is the value.
0875 */
0876     public double optDouble(String key, double defaultValue) {

0878             return this.getDouble(key);
0879         } catch (Exception e) {
0880             return defaultValue;
0881         }
0882     }

0889 * @param key
0890 * A key string.

0912             return defaultValue;

0916     /**

0924     public JSONArray optJSONArray(String key) {

0937     public JSONObject optJSONObject(String key) {

0947 * @param key
0948 * A key string.

0950 */
0951     public long optLong(String key) {
0952         return this.optLong(key, 0);
0953     }

0955     /**
0956 * Get an optional long value associated with a key, or the default if there
0957 * is no such key or if the value is not a number. If the value is a string,
0958 * an attempt will be made to evaluate it as a number.
0959 *
0960 * @param key
0961 * A key string.

0969         } catch (Exception e) {
0970             return defaultValue;
0971         }
0972     }

0974     /**
0975 * Get an optional string associated with a key. It returns an empty string
0976 * if there is no such key. If the value is not a string and is not null,
0977 * then it is converted to a string.
0978 *
0979 * @param key
0980 * A key string.
0981 * @return A string which is the value.
0982 */
0983     public String optString(String key) {
0984         return this.optString(key, "");
0985     }
0986 
0987     /**
0988 * Get an optional string associated with a key. It returns the defaultValue
0989 * if there is no such key.
0990 *
0991 * @param key
0992 * A key string.
0993 * @param defaultValue
0994 * The default.
0995 * @return A string which is the value.
0996 */
0997     public String optString(String key, String defaultValue) {
0998         Object object = this.opt(key);
0999         return NULL.equals(object) ? defaultValue : object.toString();
1000     }
1001 
1002     private void populateMap(Object bean) {
1003         Class klass = bean.getClass();
1004 
1005 // If klass is a System class then set includeSuperClass to false.
1006 
1007         boolean includeSuperClass = klass.getClassLoader() != null;
1008 
1009         Method[] methods = includeSuperClass ? klass.getMethods() : klass
1010                 .getDeclaredMethods();
1011         for (int i = 0; i < methods.length; i += 1) {
1012             try {
1013                 Method method = methods[i];
1014                 if (Modifier.isPublic(method.getModifiers())) {
1015                     String name = method.getName();
1016                     String key = "";
1017                     if (name.startsWith("get")) {
1018                         if ("getClass".equals(name)
1019                                 || "getDeclaringClass".equals(name)) {
1020                             key = "";
1021                         } else {
1022                             key = name.substring(3);
1023                         }
1024                     } else if (name.startsWith("is")) {
1025                         key = name.substring(2);
1026                     }
1027                     if (key.length() > 0
1028                             && Character.isUpperCase(key.charAt(0))
1029                             && method.getParameterTypes().length == 0) {
1030                         if (key.length() == 1) {
1031                             key = key.toLowerCase();
1032                         } else if (!Character.isUpperCase(key.charAt(1))) {
1033                             key = key.substring(0, 1).toLowerCase()
1034                                     + key.substring(1);
1035                         }
1036 
1037                         Object result = method.invoke(bean, (Object[]) null);
1038                         if (result != null) {
1039                             this.map.put(key, wrap(result));
1040                         }
1041                     }
1042                 }
1043             } catch (Exception ignore) {
1044             }
1045         }
1046     }
1047 
1048     /**
1049 * Put a key/boolean pair in the JSONObject.
1050 *
1051 * @param key
1052 * A key string.
1053 * @param value
1054 * A boolean which is the value.
1055 * @return this.
1056 * @throws JSONException
1057 * If the key is null.
1058 */
1059     public JSONObject put(String key, boolean value) throws JSONException {
1060         this.put(key, value ? Boolean.TRUE : Boolean.FALSE);
1061         return this;
1062     }
1063 
1064     /**
1065 * Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject, where the value will be a
1066 * JSONArray which is produced from a Collection.
1067 *
1068 * @param key
1069 * A key string.
1070 * @param value
1071 * A Collection value.
1072 * @return this.
1073 * @throws JSONException
1074 */
1075     public JSONObject put(String key, Collection value) throws JSONException {
1076         this.put(key, new JSONArray(value));
1077         return this;
1078     }
1079 
1080     /**
1081 * Put a key/double pair in the JSONObject.
1082 *
1083 * @param key
1084 * A key string.
1085 * @param value
1086 * A double which is the value.
1087 * @return this.
1088 * @throws JSONException
1089 * If the key is null or if the number is invalid.
1090 */
1091     public JSONObject put(String key, double value) throws JSONException {
1092         this.put(key, new Double(value));
1093         return this;
1094     }
1095 
1096     /**
1097 * Put a key/int pair in the JSONObject.
1098 *
1099 * @param key
1100 * A key string.
1101 * @param value
1102 * An int which is the value.
1103 * @return this.
1104 * @throws JSONException
1105 * If the key is null.
1106 */
1107     public JSONObject put(String key, int value) throws JSONException {
1108         this.put(key, new Integer(value));
1109         return this;
1110     }
1111 
1112     /**
1113 * Put a key/long pair in the JSONObject.
1114 *
1115 * @param key
1116 * A key string.
1117 * @param value
1118 * A long which is the value.
1119 * @return this.
1120 * @throws JSONException
1121 * If the key is null.
1122 */
1123     public JSONObject put(String key, long value) throws JSONException {
1124         this.put(key, new Long(value));
1125         return this;
1126     }
1127 
1128     /**
1129 * Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject, where the value will be a
1130 * JSONObject which is produced from a Map.
1131 *
1132 * @param key
1133 * A key string.
1134 * @param value
1135 * A Map value.
1136 * @return this.
1137 * @throws JSONException
1138 */
1139     public JSONObject put(String key, Map value) throws JSONException {
1140         this.put(key, new JSONObject(value));
1141         return this;
1142     }
1143 
1144     /**
1145 * Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject. If the value is null, then the
1146 * key will be removed from the JSONObject if it is present.
1147 *
1148 * @param key
1149 * A key string.
1150 * @param value
1151 * An object which is the value. It should be of one of these
1152 * types: Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long,
1153 * String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.
1154 * @return this.
1155 * @throws JSONException
1156 * If the value is non-finite number or if the key is null.
1157 */
1158     public JSONObject put(String key, Object value) throws JSONException {
1159         if (key == null) {
1160             throw new NullPointerException("Null key.");
1161         }
1162         if (value != null) {
1163             testValidity(value);
1164             this.map.put(key, value);
1165         } else {
1166             this.remove(key);
1167         }
1168         return this;
1169     }
1170 
1171     /**
1172 * Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject, but only if the key and the value
1173 * are both non-null, and only if there is not already a member with that
1174 * name.
1175 *
1176 * @param key
1177 * @param value
1178 * @return his.
1179 * @throws JSONException
1180 * if the key is a duplicate
1181 */
1182     public JSONObject putOnce(String key, Object value) throws JSONException {
1183         if (key != null && value != null) {
1184             if (this.opt(key) != null) {
1185                 throw new JSONException("Duplicate key \"" + key + "\"");
1186             }
1187             this.put(key, value);
1188         }
1189         return this;
1190     }
1191 
1192     /**
1193 * Put a key/value pair in the JSONObject, but only if the key and the value
1194 * are both non-null.
1195 *
1196 * @param key
1197 * A key string.
1198 * @param value
1199 * An object which is the value. It should be of one of these
1200 * types: Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long,
1201 * String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.
1202 * @return this.
1203 * @throws JSONException
1204 * If the value is a non-finite number.
1205 */
1206     public JSONObject putOpt(String key, Object value) throws JSONException {
1207         if (key != null && value != null) {
1208             this.put(key, value);
1209         }
1210         return this;
1211     }
1212 
1213     /**
1214 * Produce a string in double quotes with backslash sequences in all the
1215 * right places. A backslash will be inserted within </, producing <\/,
1216 * allowing JSON text to be delivered in HTML. In JSON text, a string cannot
1217 * contain a control character or an unescaped quote or backslash.
1218 *
1219 * @param string
1220 * A String
1221 * @return A String correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.
1222 */
1223     public static String quote(String string) {
1224         StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
1225         synchronized (sw.getBuffer()) {
1226             try {
1227                 return quote(string, sw).toString();
1228             } catch (IOException ignored) {
1229                 // will never happen - we are writing to a string writer
1230                 return "";
1231             }
1232         }
1233     }
1234 
1235     public static Writer quote(String string, Writer w) throws IOException {
1236         if (string == null || string.length() == 0) {
1237             w.write("\"\"");
1238             return w;
1239         }
1240 
1241         char b;
1242         char c = 0;
1243         String hhhh;
1244         int i;
1245         int len = string.length();
1246 
1247         w.write('"');
1248         for (i = 0; i < len; i += 1) {
1249             b = c;
1250             c = string.charAt(i);
1251             switch (c) {
1252             case '\\':
1253             case '"':
1254                 w.write('\\');
1255                 w.write(c);
1256                 break;
1257             case '/':
1258                 if (b == '<') {
1259                     w.write('\\');
1260                 }
1261                 w.write(c);
1262                 break;
1263             case '\b':
1264                 w.write("\\b");
1265                 break;
1266             case '\t':
1267                 w.write("\\t");
1268                 break;
1269             case '\n':
1270                 w.write("\\n");
1271                 break;
1272             case '\f':
1273                 w.write("\\f");
1274                 break;
1275             case '\r':
1276                 w.write("\\r");
1277                 break;
1278             default:
1279                 if (c < ' ' || (c >= '\u0080' && c < '\u00a0')
1280                         || (c >= '\u2000' && c < '\u2100')) {
1281                     w.write("\\u");
1282                     hhhh = Integer.toHexString(c);
1283                     w.write("0000", 0, 4 - hhhh.length());
1284                     w.write(hhhh);
1285                 } else {
1286                     w.write(c);
1287                 }
1288             }
1289         }
1290         w.write('"');
1291         return w;
1292     }
1293 
1294     /**
1295 * Remove a name and its value, if present.
1296 *
1297 * @param key
1298 * The name to be removed.
1299 * @return The value that was associated with the name, or null if there was
1300 * no value.
1301 */
1302     public Object remove(String key) {
1303         return this.map.remove(key);
1304     }
1305 
1306     /**
1307 * Try to convert a string into a number, boolean, or null. If the string
1308 * can't be converted, return the string.
1309 *
1310 * @param string
1311 * A String.
1312 * @return A simple JSON value.
1313 */
1314     public static Object stringToValue(String string) {
1315         Double d;
1316         if (string.equals("")) {
1317             return string;
1318         }
1319         if (string.equalsIgnoreCase("true")) {
1320             return Boolean.TRUE;
1321         }
1322         if (string.equalsIgnoreCase("false")) {
1323             return Boolean.FALSE;
1324         }
1325         if (string.equalsIgnoreCase("null")) {
1326             return JSONObject.NULL;
1327         }
1328 
1329         /*
1330 * If it might be a number, try converting it. If a number cannot be
1331 * produced, then the value will just be a string.
1332 */
1333 
1334         char b = string.charAt(0);
1335         if ((b >= '0' && b <= '9') || b == '-') {
1336             try {
1337                 if (string.indexOf('.') > -1 || string.indexOf('e') > -1
1338                         || string.indexOf('E') > -1) {
1339                     d = Double.valueOf(string);
1340                     if (!d.isInfinite() && !d.isNaN()) {
1341                         return d;
1342                     }
1343                 } else {
1344                     Long myLong = new Long(string);
1345                     if (string.equals(myLong.toString())) {
1346                         if (myLong.longValue() == myLong.intValue()) {
1347                             return new Integer(myLong.intValue());
1348                         } else {
1349                             return myLong;
1350                         }
1351                     }
1352                 }
1353             } catch (Exception ignore) {
1354             }
1355         }
1356         return string;
1357     }
1358 
1359     /**
1360 * Throw an exception if the object is a NaN or infinite number.
1361 *
1362 * @param o
1363 * The object to test.
1364 * @throws JSONException
1365 * If o is a non-finite number.
1366 */
1367     public static void testValidity(Object o) throws JSONException {
1368         if (o != null) {
1369             if (o instanceof Double) {
1370                 if (((Double) o).isInfinite() || ((Double) o).isNaN()) {
1371                     throw new JSONException(
1372                             "JSON does not allow non-finite numbers.");
1373                 }
1374             } else if (o instanceof Float) {
1375                 if (((Float) o).isInfinite() || ((Float) o).isNaN()) {
1376                     throw new JSONException(
1377                             "JSON does not allow non-finite numbers.");
1378                 }
1379             }
1380         }
1381     }
1382 
1383     /**
1384 * Produce a JSONArray containing the values of the members of this
1385 * JSONObject.
1386 *
1387 * @param names
1388 * A JSONArray containing a list of key strings. This determines
1389 * the sequence of the values in the result.
1390 * @return A JSONArray of values.
1391 * @throws JSONException
1392 * If any of the values are non-finite numbers.
1393 */
1394     public JSONArray toJSONArray(JSONArray names) throws JSONException {
1395         if (names == null || names.length() == 0) {
1396             return null;
1397         }
1398         JSONArray ja = new JSONArray();
1399         for (int i = 0; i < names.length(); i += 1) {
1400             ja.put(this.opt(names.getString(i)));
1401         }
1402         return ja;
1403     }
1404 
1405     /**
1406 * Make a JSON text of this JSONObject. For compactness, no whitespace is
1407 * added. If this would not result in a syntactically correct JSON text,
1408 * then null will be returned instead.
1409 * <p>
1410 * Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
1411 *
1412 * @return a printable, displayable, portable, transmittable representation
1413 * of the object, beginning with <code>{</code>&nbsp;<small>(left
1414 * brace)</small> and ending with <code>}</code>&nbsp;<small>(right
1415 * brace)</small>.
1416 */
1417     public String toString() {
1418         try {
1419             return this.toString(0);
1420         } catch (Exception e) {
1421             return null;
1422         }
1423     }
1424 
1425     /**
1426 * Make a prettyprinted JSON text of this JSONObject.
1427 * <p>
1428 * Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
1429 *
1430 * @param indentFactor
1431 * The number of spaces to add to each level of indentation.
1432 * @return a printable, displayable, portable, transmittable representation
1433 * of the object, beginning with <code>{</code>&nbsp;<small>(left
1434 * brace)</small> and ending with <code>}</code>&nbsp;<small>(right
1435 * brace)</small>.
1436 * @throws JSONException
1437 * If the object contains an invalid number.
1438 */
1439     public String toString(int indentFactor) throws JSONException {
1440         StringWriter w = new StringWriter();
1441         synchronized (w.getBuffer()) {
1442             return this.write(w, indentFactor, 0).toString();
1443         }
1444     }
1445 
1446     /**
1447 * Make a JSON text of an Object value. If the object has an
1448 * value.toJSONString() method, then that method will be used to produce the
1449 * JSON text. The method is required to produce a strictly conforming text.
1450 * If the object does not contain a toJSONString method (which is the most
1451 * common case), then a text will be produced by other means. If the value
1452 * is an array or Collection, then a JSONArray will be made from it and its
1453 * toJSONString method will be called. If the value is a MAP, then a
1454 * JSONObject will be made from it and its toJSONString method will be
1455 * called. Otherwise, the value's toString method will be called, and the
1456 * result will be quoted.
1457 *
1458 * <p>
1459 * Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
1460 *
1461 * @param value
1462 * The value to be serialized.
1463 * @return a printable, displayable, transmittable representation of the
1464 * object, beginning with <code>{</code>&nbsp;<small>(left
1465 * brace)</small> and ending with <code>}</code>&nbsp;<small>(right
1466 * brace)</small>.
1467 * @throws JSONException
1468 * If the value is or contains an invalid number.
1469 */
1470     public static String valueToString(Object value) throws JSONException {
1471         if (value == null || value.equals(null)) {
1472             return "null";
1473         }
1474         if (value instanceof JSONString) {
1475             Object object;
1476             try {
1477                 object = ((JSONString) value).toJSONString();
1478             } catch (Exception e) {
1479                 throw new JSONException(e);
1480             }
1481             if (object instanceof String) {
1482                 return (String) object;
1483             }
1484             throw new JSONException("Bad value from toJSONString: " + object);
1485         }
1486         if (value instanceof Number) {
1487             return numberToString((Number) value);
1488         }
1489         if (value instanceof Boolean || value instanceof JSONObject
1490                 || value instanceof JSONArray) {
1491             return value.toString();
1492         }
1493         if (value instanceof Map) {
1494             return new JSONObject((Map) value).toString();
1495         }
1496         if (value instanceof Collection) {
1497             return new JSONArray((Collection) value).toString();
1498         }
1499         if (value.getClass().isArray()) {
1500             return new JSONArray(value).toString();
1501         }
1502         return quote(value.toString());
1503     }
1504 
1505     /**
1506 * Wrap an object, if necessary. If the object is null, return the NULL
1507 * object. If it is an array or collection, wrap it in a JSONArray. If it is
1508 * a map, wrap it in a JSONObject. If it is a standard property (Double,
1509 * String, et al) then it is already wrapped. Otherwise, if it comes from
1510 * one of the java packages, turn it into a string. And if it doesn't, try
1511 * to wrap it in a JSONObject. If the wrapping fails, then null is returned.
1512 *
1513 * @param object
1514 * The object to wrap
1515 * @return The wrapped value
1516 */
1517     public static Object wrap(Object object) {
1518         try {
1519             if (object == null) {
1520                 return NULL;
1521             }
1522             if (object instanceof JSONObject || object instanceof JSONArray
1523                     || NULL.equals(object) || object instanceof JSONString
1524                     || object instanceof Byte || object instanceof Character
1525                     || object instanceof Short || object instanceof Integer
1526                     || object instanceof Long || object instanceof Boolean
1527                     || object instanceof Float || object instanceof Double
1528                     || object instanceof String) {
1529                 return object;
1530             }
1531 
1532             if (object instanceof Collection) {
1533                 return new JSONArray((Collection) object);
1534             }
1535             if (object.getClass().isArray()) {
1536                 return new JSONArray(object);
1537             }
1538             if (object instanceof Map) {
1539                 return new JSONObject((Map) object);
1540             }
1541             Package objectPackage = object.getClass().getPackage();
1542             String objectPackageName = objectPackage != null ? objectPackage
1543                     .getName() : "";
1544             if (objectPackageName.startsWith("java.")
1545                     || objectPackageName.startsWith("javax.")
1546                     || object.getClass().getClassLoader() == null) {
1547                 return object.toString();
1548             }
1549             return new JSONObject(object);
1550         } catch (Exception exception) {
1551             return null;
1552         }
1553     }
1554 
1555     /**
1556 * Write the contents of the JSONObject as JSON text to a writer. For
1557 * compactness, no whitespace is added.
1558 * <p>
1559 * Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
1560 *
1561 * @return The writer.
1562 * @throws JSONException
1563 */
1564     public Writer write(Writer writer) throws JSONException {
1565         return this.write(writer, 0, 0);
1566     }
1567 
1568     static final Writer writeValue(Writer writer, Object value,
1569             int indentFactor, int indent) throws JSONException, IOException {
1570         if (value == null || value.equals(null)) {
1571             writer.write("null");
1572         } else if (value instanceof JSONObject) {
1573             ((JSONObject) value).write(writer, indentFactor, indent);
1574         } else if (value instanceof JSONArray) {
1575             ((JSONArray) value).write(writer, indentFactor, indent);
1576         } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1577             new JSONObject((Map) value).write(writer, indentFactor, indent);
1578         } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1579             new JSONArray((Collection) value).write(writer, indentFactor,
1580                     indent);
1581         } else if (value.getClass().isArray()) {
1582             new JSONArray(value).write(writer, indentFactor, indent);
1583         } else if (value instanceof Number) {
1584             writer.write(numberToString((Number) value));
1585         } else if (value instanceof Boolean) {
1586             writer.write(value.toString());
1587         } else if (value instanceof JSONString) {
1588             Object o;
1589             try {
1590                 o = ((JSONString) value).toJSONString();
1591             } catch (Exception e) {
1592                 throw new JSONException(e);
1593             }
1594             writer.write(o != null ? o.toString() : quote(value.toString()));
1595         } else {
1596             quote(value.toString(), writer);
1597         }
1598         return writer;
1599     }
1600 
1601     static final void indent(Writer writer, int indent) throws IOException {
1602         for (int i = 0; i < indent; i += 1) {
1603             writer.write(' ');
1604         }
1605     }
1606 
1607     /**
1608 * Write the contents of the JSONObject as JSON text to a writer. For
1609 * compactness, no whitespace is added.
1610 * <p>
1611 * Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
1612 *
1613 * @return The writer.
1614 * @throws JSONException
1615 */
1616     Writer write(Writer writer, int indentFactor, int indent)
1617             throws JSONException {
1618         try {
1619             boolean commanate = false;
1620             final int length = this.length();
1621             Iterator keys = this.keys();
1622             writer.write('{');
1623 
1624             if (length == 1) {
1625                 Object key = keys.next();
1626                 writer.write(quote(key.toString()));
1627                 writer.write(':');
1628                 if (indentFactor > 0) {
1629                     writer.write(' ');
1630                 }
1631                 writeValue(writer, this.map.get(key), indentFactor, indent);
1632             } else if (length != 0) {
1633                 final int newindent = indent + indentFactor;
1634                 while (keys.hasNext()) {
1635                     Object key = keys.next();
1636                     if (commanate) {
1637                         writer.write(',');
1638                     }
1639                     if (indentFactor > 0) {
1640                         writer.write('\n');
1641                     }
1642                     indent(writer, newindent);
1643                     writer.write(quote(key.toString()));
1644                     writer.write(':');
1645                     if (indentFactor > 0) {
1646                         writer.write(' ');
1647                     }
1648                     writeValue(writer, this.map.get(key), indentFactor,
1649                             newindent);
1650                     commanate = true;
1651                 }
1652                 if (indentFactor > 0) {
1653                     writer.write('\n');
1654                 }
1655                 indent(writer, indent);
1656             }
1657             writer.write('}');
1658             return writer;
1659         } catch (IOException exception) {
1660             throw new JSONException(exception);
1661         }
1662     }
1663 
1664 }
  JavaDoq: JSONObject.java
